Key Match Events: Virgil van Dijk was sent off for the first time in his Netherlands career in a 1-1 Nations League draw with Hungary.
Denzel Dumfries scored an equaliser for the Netherlands after Van Dijk's red card.
Roland Sallai scored a first-half goal for Hungary.
Post-Match Reflections: Virgil van Dijk said he was 'angry' with the decision to give him the first of two yellow cards.
Netherlands coach Ronald Koeman was also left perplexed by his captain's first booking.
Koeman confirmed he will not add to his squad for Monday's visit to Germany.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands drew 1-1 with Hungary in the Nations League, with the result leaving them two points behind Germany in Group A3.
The match was a crucial fixture for the Netherlands as they looked to rise to the top of the pool or be cut five points adrift with two games to play.
Others: Virgil van Dijk left the national camp to return to Liverpool after being sent off.
Koeman will not be naming a replacement for Van Dijk in the squad.
